thread.section_title: Travel News, Tips, and Guides - USATODAY.com
thread.title: Coming in 100 days: New York's hottest cruise ship ever
thread.title_full: Coming in 100 days: New York's hottest cruise ship ever

author: Gene Sloan , USA TODAY
title: Coming in 100 days: New York's hottest cruise ship ever
text:
Royal Caribbean's newest ship, the 4,180-passenger Anthem of the Seas, was christened on April 20, 2015 in Southampton, UK. Roy Riley /sbw-photo Fullscreen The top deck of Anthem of the Seas features a large main pool area open to the sky. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The main pool on Anthem of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas' main pool area has a large LED screen for showing movies and other entertainment. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem also has an interior pool area with a retractable glass roof that can be opened on warmer days. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another view of the indoor/outdoor pool on Anthem of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Lounge chairs line a shallow pool area in Anthem of the Seas' retractable glass-roofed pool area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Perhaps the most notable feature on Anthem of the Seas' top deck is North Star -- a giant mechanical arm that takes passengers soaring above the vessel in a glass-enclosed capsule. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The view from Anthem of the Seas' North Star as it rises above the English Channel on April 19, 2015. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The H20 water play zone atop Anthem of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In addition to two large hot tubs, the main pool area has a swirling wave pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A Johnny Rockets burger eatery is located on Deck 14 near the main pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas was built by the Meyer Werft shipyard in Papenburg, Germany, as noted on its official name plate located on Deck 14 near Johnny Rockets Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The heart of Anthem of the Seas' interior is the Royal Esplanade -- a multi-deck boulevard that's home to eateries, lounges, shops and entertainment venues. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on Anthem of the Seas is an interactive chandelier overlooking the Royal Esplanade by artist Rafael Lozano-Hemmer. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A centerpiece of the ship's interior public area, the interactive chandelier by artist Rafael Lozano-Hemmer has 200 light bulbs that glimmer to the recorded heartbeats of previous passengers who place their hands on a monitor below it. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on Anthem of the Seas is a soaring art piece the fills the multi-deck atrium near the middle of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A close-up view of the new art piece in the atrium. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Jamie's Italian on Anthem of the Seas is celebrity chef Jamie Oliver's second restaurant at sea -- the first is on sister ship Quantum of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Jamie's Italian eatery on Anthem of the Seas has a distinctly different color scheme than the one on sister ship Quantum of the Seas highlighted by blue and yellow chairs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 5 of Anthem of the Seas along The Via, Jamie's Italian servesfresh pasta made on board daily. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A sampling of appetizers available at Jamie's Italian. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A large tuba-like reflective art piece acts as a center piece just outside of Jamie's Italian in The Via on Deck 6 on Anthem of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to Jamie's Italian is Vintages, Royal Caribbean's signature wine bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Vintages offers tastings of wines from around the world. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In addition to bartender-served drinks, Vintages is home to automatic wine dispensers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A seating along The Via near Vintages. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Quantum of the Seas, Anthem has a large, living-room like multi-purpose lounge called two70 that is home to shows in the evening. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Quantum of the Seas, Anthem also has a casual cafe and eatery called the cafe@two70 that is connected to the two70 lounge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Cafe@two70 serves up breakfast burritos and bagels in the morning and sandwiches and made-to-order salads at lunchtime. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A premium coffee bar is part of the casual cafe@two70, which is connected to the two70 lounge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A new-for-Anthem art piece just outside the two70 lounge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An unusual cruise ship feature on Anthem of the Seas is the Bionic Bar -- a bar where the bartenders are robots. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The robot bartenders at the Bionic Bar mix drinks as passengers watch. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located along the Royal Esplanade is Izumi, a 40-seat, extra-charge Japanese restaurant. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other Royal Caribbean ships, Anthem of the Seas features a Schooner Bar -- a signature lounge for the line. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas also features one of Royal Caribbean's signature, extra-charge Chops Grille steakhouses. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Music Hall on Anthem of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bar at the Music Hall. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A two-story-high strip of shopping outlets along the Royal Esplanade includes an Armani store. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Royal Esplanade is home to Michael's Genuine Pub -- the second American gastropub at sea (the first is on Quantum of the Seas). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Michael's Genuine Pub Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Next to Michael's Genuine Pub on the Royal Esplanade is a Sorrento's pizza outlet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Inside the Sorrento's pizza outlet on the Royal Esplanade. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 4 along the Royal Esplanade, the Latin-infused Boleros bar serves mojitos and margeritas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bar at Boleros. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A wall-length art piece by Italian artist Silvio Lorio that uses LED lights is located on Deck 5 at the entrance to the Royal Esplanade. It's called Odysseia, FOS, Fotos #15. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on Anthem of the Seas is an art installation on Deck 5 that features works by three artists, Richard Hudson, Andrea Stanislav and Nicole Cohen. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The most fanciful restaurant on Anthem of the Seas is Wonderland, another new concept for Royal Caribbean that debuted on Quantum of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Wonderland offers imaginative cuisine in an Alice in Wonderland-themed space. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The largest eatery on Anthem is the casual Windjammer Marketplace, located near the top of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Hand washing stations are located in a nook at the entrance to the Windjammer's Marketplace. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Fresh-made bread at the Windjammer's Marketplace. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Windjammer's Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A small outdoor seating area is available at the back of the Windjammer Marketplace overlooking the ship's stern. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas' Casino Royale is one of the largest casinos at sea, filling up a significant portion of a deck. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Casino Royale features dozens of slot machines and table games. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 4, the American Icon Grill is one of four large restaurants on Anthem of the Seas that are available to passengers at no extra charge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The American Icon Grill seats 430 people and serves class American cuisine Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also on Deck 4 is Silk, an Asian fusion restaurant that also is available to passengers at no extra charge Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 3, the Grande Restaurant is billed as a luxuriant nod to a bygone era and is the most formal of Quantum's four larger restaurants. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 3, Chic serves up contemporary cuisine in a contemporary setting. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Quantum of the Seas, Anthem features a multi-use indoor activity zone called SeaPlex. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the activities offered in SeaPlex is roller skating. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The multi-use SeaPlex on Anthem of the Seas also is used for bumper cars. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Pods in the SeaPlex are filled with games such as foosball and ping pong. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The SeaPlex Dog House, located in a food truck-like nook of the SeaPlex, serves up traditional hot dogs, brats and sausages. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A giant sculpture of a Giraffe wearing a swimsuit and buoy by artist Jean Francois Fourtou, named GiGi, is a focal point of Anthem of the Seas' exterior decks. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other Royal Caribbean ships, Anthem of the Seas has a rock climbing wall. It's located on Deck 15. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Sunset over the Solent River near Southampton, UK as the Anthem of the Seas heads to sea on April 18, 2015. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas' FlowRider surfing pool is located at the back of the ship on Deck 15. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas is the seventh Royal Caribbean ship with a FlowRider surfing pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem also features RipCord by iFLY, the second skydiving simulator at sea (the first is on Quantum of the Seas). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the front of the ship, the glass-enclosed Solarium is an adults-only retreat with cascading lagoons and an indoor pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Large hot tubs overlooking the front of the ship are among the allures of Anthem of the Seas' adults-only Solarium. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas has 2,090 cabins, more than three quarters of which are balcony cabins such as this one. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Most balcony cabins measure 198 square feet and feature two twin beds that convert to a royal king. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins also feature a desk area and a sofa. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Built-in storage areas flank a built-in sofa in balcony cabins. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Built-in storage areas in balcony cabins include room for hanging clothes, shelving and a personal safe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bathroom of a standard balcony cabin found on Anthem of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem's balcony cabin bathrooms feature relatively spacious showers for a standard cabin on a cruise ship Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The balcony of a balcony cabin on Anthem of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Lounge chairs line the sides of Deck 15 on Anthem of the Seas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The largest entertainment venue on Anthem of the Seas is the Royal Theater, which will house a production of the West End's We Will Rock you and other shows. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Royal Theater can seat up to 1,300 people at once. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located along the Royal Esplanade, La Patisserie serves up pastries and coffees is a colorful, contemporary setting. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas has a small Library located in a nook just off of the Two70 lounge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas has a sprawling Vitality at Sea Spa located at the front of the ship on Deck 15. It offers a wide range of massages, wraps, facials and medi-spa treatments. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Vitality Spa offers 19 treatment rooms. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Vitality Spa also houses a hair and nail salon. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spanning two decks, the Vitality at Seas Fitness Center offers several dozen treadmills, elliptical machines and other cardio and resistance equipment. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A separate room in the Vitality at Sea Fitness Center is dedicated to spinning classes and other fitness classes, which cost $12 per person per session. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas has a game zone called the Challenger's Arcade on Deck 15 next to the SeaPlex. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 11, Anthem of the Seas' Royal Babies & Tots is a play area for children ages three months to three years. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Guest Services desk is located just off the Royal Esplanade. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Guest Services desk area includes iPad station where passengers can make restaurant reservations, reserve shows and more. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Royal Caribbean's Anthem of the Seas is registered in the Bahamas and thus flies the flag of that country off its stern. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An Anthem of the Seas life buoy at the ready atop Deck 15. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Anthem of the Seas will home port in Southampton for the summer of 2015 before permanently moving to the New York area. It'll sail out of New Jersey's Cape Liberty Cruise Port to Bermuda, the Caribbean, and Canada and New England. Roy Riley /sbw-photo Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide Royal Caribbean's newest ship, the 4,180-passenger Anthem of the Seas, was christened on April 20, 2015 in Southampton, UK. (Photo: Roy Riley /sbw-photo)
Tags Quantum of the Seas Anthem of the Seas 550 CONNECT 145 TWEET 15 LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Let the countdown begin!
Today marks exactly 100 days until one of the hottest new cruise ships of the year, Royal Caribbean's Anthem of the Seas , begins sailing year-round out of the New York area -- a deployment that has had the line's fans in the Northeast buzzing for months. And now even Royal Caribbean executives are getting excited.
"It's huge for us," senior vice president for hotel operations Mark Tamis tells USA TODAY. "The Northeast is such a hot bed of people who either have cruised with Royal Caribbean and are really loyal to the experience or are new to cruising."
For the newbies in the region, Tamis says the expectation is that Anthem's presence in the New York area starting on Nov. 4 "will kind of push them over the edge" into giving cruising a try.
Unveiled in April , Royal Caribbean's latest mega-resort at sea has spent its first few months cruising around Europe, but Royal Caribbean has been saying for more than a year that it eventually would make its permanent home at the New York area's Cape Liberty Cruise Port, located seven miles south of Manhattan in Bayonne, N.J. The ship will sail five- to 12-night voyages to Bermuda, the Bahamas, the Caribbean and New England.
USA TODAY
Five things to love about the new Anthem of the Seas
The 4,180-passenger vessel is a sister to the eight-month-old Quantum of the Seas, which sailed a brief season out of the New York area over the winter only to be redeployed earlier this year to China.
As can be seen in the photo tour in the carousel above, Anthem is packed full of such gee-whiz features as a deck-top ride into the sky and a bar with robot bartenders, both concepts that first debuted on Quantum. Other first-for-the-industry features from Quantum making a comeback include a skydiving simulator and a deck-top fun zone called the SeaPlex with bumper cars and roller skating.
Tamis says the ship is perfect for year-round sailings out of the New York area, as it has a wide variety of indoor fun zones and experiences that will appeal to passengers on off-season sailings when "it's not quite bikini weather."
One of the ship's pools has a glass-covered magrodome that can be closed during inclement weather, and there's also the adult-only Solarium sunning area at the front of the vessel that is enclosed in glass while still offering an outdoor feel, Tamis notes.
Anthem also boasts Royal Caribbean's new fast-like-on-land Voom Internet service, which surely will be a hit with a fast-paced New York crowd. No other New York-based ship offers Internet speeds that come close.
But perhaps Anthem's biggest appeal to would-be cruisers in the Northeast will be its location just a short drive away.
"This just gives them that option to not have to fly (to cruise hubs in Florida and elsewhere) and have that convenience to have the newest, greatest ship in their backyard," Tamis says.
USA TODAY Cruise in April was among a handful of U.S. media outlets to get early access to Anthem before its christening in Southampton, England . For a look inside the vessel's swankiest suites, click through the carousel below. For more of our coverage, including nearly a dozen videos, follow the links below or head to USA TODAY's Cruise Hub .
Royal Caribbean's newest ship, Anthem of the Seas, features some of the most elaborate suites at sea, including the two-deck-high, 1,640-square-foot Royal Loft Suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Sleeping up to six, the Royal Loft offers a panoramic view over the back of the ship from a two-deck-high living and dining room level. The space has a dry bar and sofa that converts into a double bed. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Royal Loft's soaring main room includes a dining table that seats up to eight people. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Royal Loft Suite has an expansive, 415-square-foot private balcony with a private whirlpool that overlook the back of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The first floor of the Royal Loft Suite also features a separate media room with a sofa that converts into a queen bed. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A stairway leads from the first floor of the Royal Loft Suite to the main bedroom on the second floor Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The main bedroom of the Royal Loft Suite, on the second floor, overlooks the main floor Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The main bedroom of a Royal Loft Suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bathroom of the Royal Loft Suite curves behind the main bedroom area and includes a large bathtub. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bathroom in Royal Loft Suites have two sinks -- one on each side of the bathtub Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bathroom of the Royal Loft Suite also has a walk-in shower Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen x Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen x Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen x Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In an unusual twist, the shower in the master bathroom of the Royal Loft Suite opens onto a private, 109-square-foot balcony overlooking the side of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The balcony area connected to the Royal Loft suite's master bedroom includes a private outdoor hot tub. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Just off the main bedroom in the Royal Loft Suite is a giant walk-in closet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The walk-in closet area next to the main bedroom of the Royal Loft Suite also has a desk area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A miniature bar is located below near the desk area of Royal Loft Suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen x Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Smaller than Royal Loft suites but still giant by cruise ship standards are Anthem of the Seas' Owner's Loft suites, which measure 975 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Two decks high, Owner's Loft suites have a combined living and dining room on their main level with a sofa that converts into a double bed. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The main level of Owner's Lofts has a desk area with a television built-in to the wall. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The second level of an Owner's Loft features a master bedroom that looks out over the two-deck-high main floor's wall-to-wall windows. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bedroom of an Owner's Loft has an 82-inch-wide royal king bed that converts into two twin beds. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located next to the bedroom, the master bathroom in an Owner's Loft has double sinks, a large walk-in shower and a toilet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other suite bathrooms on Anthem of the Seas, Owner's Loft bathrooms are sleek and contemporary in design. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The walk-in showers in Owner's Loft master bathrooms have two sets of shower heads and controls, allowing for two occupants. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Owner's Loft suites have a desk area in the hall just outside the master bedroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Owner's Loft suites also have a large walk-in closet at the end of a second-floor hall. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Owner's Loft suites have a spacious, 303-square-foot main balcony overlooking the back of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The main Owner's Suite balcony features comfortable lounge chairs and a seating area for outdoor dining. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Owner's Loft suites also have a small upper level side balcony measuring 89 square feet (shown here) as well as a second side balcony on the main level measuring 109 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Owner's Loft suites have a second guest bathroom located on the main level. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another category of giant suites on Royal Caribbean's new Anthem of the Seas is its Grand Loft suites, which also are two decks high and measures 696 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Sleeping up to four people, Grand Loft suites have an open living/dining room with a sofa that converts into a double bed. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are two Grand Loft suites on Anthem of the Seas (cabins 10320 and 10720). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Grand Loft suite has a full bathroom with shower on its main level. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The sink and toilet area of the bathroom on the main level of a Grand Loft suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Grand Loft suite has a large, 236-square-foot balcony overlooking the back of the ship that features an outdoor dining area Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Grand Loft suite balconies feature comfortable lounge chairs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other Loft suites on Anthem of the Seas, the two Grand Lofts overlook the back of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A stairway leads from the main floor of the Grand Loft Suite to an upstairs bedroom area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bedroom of a Grand Loft suite has a king size bed that can be converted into two twin beds. The bedroom overlooks the main floor of the room below Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The view from a Grand Loft suite bedroom overlooking the two-deck-high main floor and wall-to-wall windows. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bathroom of the Grand Loft suite, located just behind the master bedroom Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The master bathroom in the Grand Loft suite has a large walk-in showers with dual shower nozzles and controls Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another category of super-sized cabins on Anthem of the Seas are its nine Sky Loft suites, which are two decks high and measure 740 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The two-deck-high main room of the Sky Loft suite has floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Sky Loft suites have 183-square-foot private balconies that feature a private dining area.
